title: Quant JTBD Package
text: QuantJTBD package takes Jobs Done1 survey data (Outcome Driven Innovation2 format) measures frequency. means need ask questions 1-5 likert scale recode scales (important , Slightly important, Somewhat important, important, Extremely important) numeric factors (1-5)

title: Quant JTBD Package
text: scores calculated traditional Outcome Driven Innovation way: get bit specific, since someone’s satisfaction job doesn’t change important , importance floor opportunity, just use importance score opportunity score:
code: importance + importance - satisfaction example: 8.4 + 8.4 - 6.7 = 10.1 importance + (if importance < satisfaction, 0, - satisfaction) incorrect calculation: 6.7 + 6.7 - 8.4 = 5 correct calculation: 6.7 + (if 8.4 > 6.7, 0, else 6.7 - 8.4) = 6.7

what: Import your SPSS data into R

code: df_spss  <-  haven::read_sav("YOUR_FILE.sav") # Check out the data and their labels via the Labeled package's Dictionary functionality  dictionary <- labelled::generate_dictionary(df_spss)

what: Reanme Your Columns In This Format
title: Quant JTBD Package
text: honest, hardest part package getting data format package can accept. column needs labelled following format: “imp__“/”sat__” + “your_job_step_name” + “.name_of_job” spaces anywhere Job Step Name Jobs must literally exactly match4 importance & satisfaction columns–thing different “imp” “sat” prefix. sample column names: imp__researching.minimize_time_to_evaluate_options sat__researching.minimize_time_to_evaluate_options imp__purchasing.minimize_time_to_receive_payment_confirmation sat__purchasing.minimize_time_to_receive_payment_confirmation

previous_headings: Reanme Your Columns In This Format
title: Quant JTBD Package
text: Load data (ideally via SPSS) want use column labels graphics know scores correspond objectives. build_imp_column_names build_sat_column_names functions primarily renames column names (also change factor). Currently accepts standard format given survey instruments : DistinctQuestionId_Question_Text - Important... importance columns DistinctQuestionId_Question_Text - Satisfied... satisfaction. data isn’t format, ’ll rename manually (isn’t bad likely using mutate) specifically build_imp_column_names build_sat_column_names : Swap labels column names Remove prefix splitting space Remove suffix splitting “-” Change spaces names underscores Prefix updated columns needed imp__, sat__, .job_ _section portions column name Change haven data labels factors (renaming task, ’s part function now)

what: Renaming the columns some other way
title: Quant JTBD Package
text: Column naming RULES order able use package: job step (imp__JOB_STEP.job_name) must DISTINCT job steps job name (imp__job_step.JOB_NAME) must DISTINCT job names job step job name (imp__JOB_STEP.JOB_NAME) must IDENTICAL importance satisfaction columns–thing changes prefix: imp__researching.minimize_time_to_evaluate_options sat__researching.minimize_time_to_evaluate_options must importance satisfaction column every job want calculate spaces column name Data must factor format
